title: Introduction to Human Rights
content: Human rights are basic rights and freedoms that belong to every person in the world. They are like special rules that protect everyone, no matter who they are or where they come from.

title: Universal Declaration of Human Rights
content: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights was adopted by the United Nations in 1948. It contains 30 articles that outline the fundamental rights and freedoms that should be protected for all people.

title: Right to Education
content: Education is a fundamental human right that enables individuals to develop their potential and participate fully in society. It's essential for breaking cycles of poverty and promoting equality.

title: Freedom of Expression
content: Freedom of expression includes the right to hold opinions and to seek, receive and share information through any media. This fundamental freedom is essential for democracy and human dignity.

title: Right to Privacy
content: In the digital age, privacy rights have become increasingly important. Everyone has the right to privacy in their personal communications, data, and digital footprint.
